gcci.text: At $3.14/hr for H100s, the premium pricing reflects constrained supply chains and high capex requirements, with chip availability remaining the primary bottleneck for scaling AI infrastructure.

gtpi.text: The $1.40/1M input token pricing indicates aggressive API price wars are driving efficiency gains, while model competition forces continuous optimization to maintain cost competitiveness.

gagl.text: With 120 TWh annual load, AI computing demands are creating unprecedented grid strain, necessitating accelerated nuclear adoption and carbon footprint mitigation strategies.

aipi.text: The juxtaposition of rising infrastructure costs against aggressive pricing suggests an unsustainable growth trajectory, with bubble risks emerging from overcapacity in compute resources.
